participant_2.background:
I clean my glasses when I should be doing other things.

my inspiration is classical music.
I go to nature documentaries to feel like I'm experiencing nature without being limited by my disability.

content.text: Hey, I'm a writer, what are you up to?
I am currently watching a nature documentary about pandas.
That sounds nice. I love watching those too. I am going to school for writing, do you write?
I used to write a lot, but haven't in a while. I've been wanting to start again though.
That's awesome! I'm glad to hear that. What type of writing did you used to do?
I used to write a lot of short stories. I also wrote some poetry.
That's really cool! I love writing short stories. I've never been much for poetry.
I think it's really hard to write good poetry.
It is. I think it's really hard to write anything good, to be honest.
I totally agree. It's hard to put your thoughts and feelings into words in a way that other people can understand.
I know, right? It's so hard to convey what you're trying to say in a way that's both concise and meaningful.
It's even harder when you're trying to write in a way that's interesting and engaging.
That's the hardest part, for me at least. I want my writing to be interesting and engaging, but I also don't want to be too wordy or pretentious.
I know what you mean. I always feel like I'm using too many words or not enough.
Me too! It's a constant struggle trying to find the right balance.
It is. I'm always learning though. The more I write, the better I get at it.
I think so too. The more you write, the more you learn about your own writing style and what works best for you.
That's definitely true. I've learned a lot about myself as a writer over the years.
I'm sure you have. I'm still learning about myself as a writer, but I'm getting there.
It's a journey.
It is. But it's a fun journey
